contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person |image = | name = Joseph Vilsmaier | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1939|1|24|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Munich]], [[Germany]] | death_date = | death_place = | othername = | occupation = Film director | yearsactive = 1970-present }} '''Joseph Vilsmaier''' (born 24 January 1939) is a German film director. ==Work== After attending a boarding school near [[Augsburg]], he was trained as a technician to make film cameras and then spent nine years at a music conservatory. Following this he was a member of a jazz group. Following his work as a technician he moved into film, first as an assistant, then as a cameraman. His debut film, [[Herbstmilch (film)|Herbstmilch]] in 1988, additionally starring his wife, [[Dana Vávrová]], was a huge success, which was only to be outdone by ''Comedian Harmonists'' in 1997. Film critics are not that fond of Vilsmaier's work. On most of the films he has directed, Vilsmaier is also the first cameraman. While filming his latest film ''The Last Train'' (German: ''Der Letzte Zug''), probably the last movie produced by [[Artur Brauner]], he was injured by the collapse of a camera tower. From then on his ability to work was very limited, so Vávrová took over directing. The two of them were awarded the special prize by the jury at the 2006 [[Bayerischer Filmpreis|Bavarian Film Awards]] for ''The Last Train''. His wife [[Dana Vávrová]] died on 5 February 2009.<ref>{{cite web | title =Schauspielerin Dana Vávrová stirbt mit 41 Jahren | work =Die Welt | publisher =Axel Springer AG | date =2009-02-06 | url =http://www.welt.de/kultur/article3158139/Schauspielerin-Dana-Vavrova-stirbt-mit-41-Jahren.html | accessdate =2009-02-08 }}</ref> They had three daughters together, [[Janina Vilsmaier|Janina]], [[Theresa Vilsmaier|Theresa]], and [[Josefina Vilsmaier]]. They are all actresses and have starred in a number of his films. ==Awards== * [[Bayerischer Filmpreis|Bavarian Film Awards]] **1990 Best Production **1992 Bavarian Film Awards, Best Producing, Best Cinematography **1995 Bavarian Film Award, Best Production **1997 Bavarian Film Award, Best Director [http://www.bayern.de/Anlage19170/PreistraegerdesBayerischenFilmpreises-Pierrot.pdf] **2006 Bavarian Film Award, Special Prize [http://www.bayern.de/Pressemitteilungen-.1255.19209/index.htm] * [[18th Moscow International Film Festival]] ** Nominated - ''Stalingrad''<ref name="Moscow1993">{{cite web |url=http://www.moscowfilmfestival.ru/miff34/eng/archives/?year=1993 |title=18th Moscow International Film Festival (1993) |accessdate=2013-03-09 |work=MIFF}}</ref> ==Filmography== *''[[Herbstmilch (film)|Herbstmilch]]'' (1988) *''Rama dama'' (1990) *''[[Stalingrad (1993 film)|Stalingrad]]'' (1993) *''[[Charlie & Louise - Das doppelte Lottchen]]'' (1994) *''[[Brother of Sleep|Schlafes Bruder]]'' (1995) *''Und keiner weint mir nach'' (1996) *''[[Comedian Harmonists (film)|Comedian Harmonists]]'' (1997) *''Marlene'' (2000) *''Leo und Claire'' (2002) *''[[Der letzte Zug]]'' (2006) *''M/S Gustloff - Ship Of No Return'' (2008) *''[[Nanga Parbat (film)|Nanga Parbat]]'' (2010) *''Bavaria - Traumreise durch Bayern'' (2012) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDB name|id=0005917|name=Joseph Vilsmaier}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{Authority control|VIAF=34665782}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Vilsmaier, Joseph | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German film director | DATE OF BIRTH = 24 January 1939 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vilsmaier, Joseph}} [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:German film directors]] [[Category:German-language film directors]] [[Category:Mountaineering films]] [[Category:People from Munich]]
